New Records: Chris Sale set a record for most strikeouts by a Braves left-hander in a single regular season with 193
Key Match Events: Sale struck out Jose Miranda in the first inning to claim a record previously held by Hall of Famers Warren Spahn and Tom Glavine
Sale struck out Miranda, then walked Carlos Santana to load the bases and got Christian Vázquez on a weak roller to shortstop to keep the Twins off the scoreboard
Sale struck out Vázquez on a wicked slider to strand two runners on base
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Brian Snitker emphasized the importance of Sale's performance, saying 'Expectations are really big right now because he's been doing that. You expect him to do well because he has been.'
Post-Match Reflections: Sale dropped his season ERA to 2.58, tying him with Detroit's Tarik Skubal for the Major League lead in wins and ERA (among qualified players) this season
Sale tied San Diego's Dylan Cease for the most strikeouts this season with 197, sparking not only Cy Young buzz but giving him a legitimate chance of winning pitching's Triple Crown
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Braves won five straight road games and are 13-5 overall since August 10, the most wins of any NL team in that span
The Braves swept the Twins, a great squad that is more than likely going to the playoffs
